repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes #2940 

This PR fixes a typo that caused `cdef public` functions from .pxd files to be erroneously mangled.

The unmangled name is chosen when the definition from the .py file is processed, but on the condition that the cname determined while processing the declaration from the .pxd file was the mangled one (instead of a user-defined one).

It also adds a test for the ticket.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
#ifndef A_H
#define A_H

int bar();

#endif
```

I'd rather keep this compatible as possible if there isn't a good reason to do otherwise
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+# mode: compile
+# ticket: 2940
+
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+#PYTHON -c "import a; a.test()"
+
+######## setup.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build import cythonize
+from Cython.Distutils.extension import Extension
+from distutils.core import setup
+
+setup(
+    ext_modules=cythonize([Extension("a", ["a.py", "b.c"])]),
+)
+
+######## a.pxd ########
+
+cdef public int foo()
+
+cdef extern from "b.h":
+    cpdef int bar()
+
+######## a.py ########
+
+def foo():
+    return 42
+
+def test():
+    assert bar() == 42
+
+######## b.h ########
+
+#pragma once
+
+int bar();

comment_data.body: Is there a reason not to run it? Importing it at least makes sure it's compiled and linked correctly.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+# mode: compile
+# ticket: 2940
+
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+#PYTHON -c "import a; a.test()"

comment_data.body: Oops, looks like a leftover '#' from my debugging session^^
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+# mode: compile
+# ticket: 2940
+
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+#PYTHON -c "import a; a.test()"

comment_data.body: Damned, looks like I failed a copy/paste! 😭

commit.message:
[Ticket 2940] fix mangling for .pxd cdef public functions

This commit fixes a typo that caused `cdef public` functions from .pxd
files to be erroneously mangled. The unmangled name is chosen when the
definition from the .py file is processed, but on the condition that the
cname determined while processing the declaration from the .pxd file was
the mangled one (instead of a user-defined one).
The commit also adds a test for the ticket.
Add to the list of skipped test because of a PyPy2 issue

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: [Ticket 2940] fix mangling for .pxd cdef public functions
